00002 %> @brief GUI use to display potential distribution, capacitances and
00003 %> potential  map sum.
00004 % =====================================================================
00005 function varargout = Pot_viewer(varargin)
00006 % POT_VIEWER M-file for Pot_viewer.fig
00007 %      Run file from main program directory
00008 %      POT_VIEWER, by itself, creates a new POT_VIEWER or raises the existing
00009 %      singleton*.
00010 %
00011 %      H = POT_VIEWER returns the handle to a new POT_VIEWER or the handle to
00012 %      the existing singleton*.
00013 %
00014 %      POT_VIEWER('CALLBACK',hObject,eventData,handles,...) calls the local
00015 %      function named CALLBACK in POT_VIEWER.M with the given input arguments.
00016 %
00017 %      POT_VIEWER('Property','Value',...) creates a new POT_VIEWER or raises the
00018 %      existing singleton*.  Starting from the left, property value pairs are
00019 %      applied to the GUI before Pot_viewer_OpeningFcn gets called.  An
00020 %      unrecognized property name or invalid value makes property application
00021 %      stop.  All inputs are passed to Pot_viewer_OpeningFcn via varargin.
00022 %
00023 %      *See GUI Options on GUIDE's Tools menu.  Choose "GUI allows only one
00024 %      instance to run (singleton)".
00025 %
00026 % See also: GUIDE, GUIDATA, GUIHANDLES
00027 
00028 % Edit the above text to modify the response to help Pot_viewer
00029 
00030 % Last Modified by GUIDE v2.5 18-Aug-2010 20:56:37
00031 
00032 % Begin initialization code - DO NOT EDIT
00033 gui_Singleton = 1;
00034 gui_State = struct('gui_Name',       mfilename, ...
00035                    'gui_Singleton',  gui_Singleton, ...
00036                    'gui_OpeningFcn', @Pot_viewer_OpeningFcn, ...
00037                    'gui_OutputFcn',  @Pot_viewer_OutputFcn, ...
00038                    'gui_LayoutFcn',  [] , ...
00039                    'gui_Callback',   []);
00040 if nargin && ischar(varargin{1})
00041     gui_State.gui_Callback = str2func(varargin{1});
00042 end
00043 
00044 if nargout
00045     [varargout{1:nargout}] = gui_mainfcn(gui_State, varargin{:});
00046 else
00047     gui_mainfcn(gui_State, varargin{:});
00048 end
00049 % End initialization code - DO NOT EDIT

00051 % =====================================================================
00052 %> @brief Executes just before Pot_viewer is made visible. Search for
00053 %> Electrical field objects. Set them  in list box. Plot first potential
00054 %> distribution.
00055 % =====================================================================
00056 function Pot_viewer_OpeningFcn(hObject, eventdata, handles, varargin)
00057 % This function has no output args, see OutputFcn.
00058 % hObject    handle to figure
00059 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00060 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00061 % varargin   command line arguments to Pot_viewer (see VARARGIN)
00062 
00063 % Choose default command line output for Pot_viewer
00064 handles.output = hObject;
00065 
00066 % Update handles structure
00067 guidata(hObject, handles);
00068 
00069 
00070 update_listbox(handles)
00071 
00072 axes(handles.axessens);
00073 %cla;
00074 %set(handles.axessens,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00075 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00076 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00077 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00078                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00079                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00080 else
00081                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00082 end 
00083 
00084      komenda=[var1,'.draw_potential(','1',');'];
00085     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00086      evalin('base',komenda);     
00087 
00088 % This sets up the initial plot - only do when we are invisible
00089 % so window can get raised using Pot_viewer.
00090 
00091

00093 % uiwait(handles.figure1);

00133 function CloseMenuItem_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00134 % hObject    handle to CloseMenuItem (see GCBO)
00135 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00136 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00137 selection = questdlg(['Close ' get(handles.figure1,'Name') '?'],...
00138                      ['Close ' get(handles.figure1,'Name') '...'],...
00139                      'Yes','No','Yes');
00140 if strcmp(selection,'No')
00141     return;
00142 end

00147 % =====================================================================
00148 %> @brief Executes on slider movement. Change potential map.
00149 % =====================================================================
00150 function slider1_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00151 % hObject    handle to slider1 (see GCBO)
00152 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00153 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00154 
00155 % Hints: get(hObject,'Value') returns position of slider
00156 %        get(hObject,'Min') and get(hObject,'Max') to determine range of slider
00157 
00158 
00159 axes(handles.axessens);
00160 %cla;
00161 %set(handles.axessens,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00162 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00163 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00164 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00165                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00166                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00167 else
00168                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00169 end 
00170 
00171 
00172 sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');
00173 val=round(sliderValue);
00174 % get from workspace
00175 pot_num_max=evalin('base',[var1,'.number_of_electrodes;']);% its equal to number of pot. maps
00176 set(handles.slider1,'Max', pot_num_max);
00177 if(val<=0)
00178     val=1;
00179 elseif (val>pot_num_max)
00180     val=1;
00181 end
00182 %'Sensitivity'
00183 
00184      komenda=[var1,'.draw_potential(',num2str(val),');'];
00185     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00186      evalin('base',komenda);     
00187 
00188 
00189 % --- Executes during object creation, after setting all properties.
00190 function slider1_CreateFcn(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00191 % hObject    handle to slider1 (see GCBO)
00192 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00193 % handles    empty - handles not created until after all CreateFcns called
00194 
00195 % Hint: slider controls usually have a light gray background.
00196 if isequal(get(hObject,'BackgroundColor'), get(0,'defaultUicontrolBackgroundColor'))
00197     set(hObject,'BackgroundColor',[.9 .9 .9]);
00198 end

00232 % --- Executes during object creation, after setting all properties.
00233 function listbox1_CreateFcn(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00234 % hObject    handle to listbox1 (see GCBO)
00235 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00236 % handles    empty - handles not created until after all CreateFcns called
00237

00239 %       See ISPC and COMPUTER.

00242 end

00244 % =====================================================================
00245 %> @brief Search for Electrical field objects in workspace.
00246 % =====================================================================
00247 function update_listbox(handles)
00248 %http://www.mathworks.com/access/helpdesk/help/techdoc/creating_guis/f6-7673.html
00249 % get all workspace variables
00250 vars = evalin('base','who');
00251 k=1;
00252 any_elements=0;
00253 
00254 % search for Electrical_field object in workspace 
00255 for i=1:length(vars);
00256         
00257     komenda=['isa(',vars{i},',','''Electrical_field_2D''',');'];    
00258     ret = evalin('base',komenda);    
00259     if ret==1
00260         ef_vector(k)=vars(i);
00261         k=k+1;
00262         any_elements=1;
00263     end
00264 end
00265 
00266 if any_elements==0
00267     errordlg('There is''t Electrical_field object in workspace. First run simulation.',...
00268         'Error');
00269     error('There is''t Electrical_field object in workspace. First run simulation.');
00270 end
00271 
00272 set(handles.listbox1,'String',ef_vector)
00273 
00274 % =====================================================================
00275 %> @brief Executes on button pot sum press. Draw potential sum map in new
00276 %> figure.
00277 % =====================================================================
00278 function pushbutton4_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00279 % hObject    handle to pushbutton4 (see GCBO)
00280 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00281 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00282 
00283 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00284 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00285 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00286                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00287                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00288 else
00289                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00290 end 
00291 
00292 %'Sensitivity'
00293 
00294  fh_sum = figure;
00295  name=[var1,' Potential Map Sum'];
00296  set(fh_sum,'Name',name);
00297  komenda=[var1,'.draw_sum_pot_map();'];
00298  evalin('base',komenda);   
00299
